title: microsoft c++ error crashing game?
body:
so today after i had played 3 games of the nemesis draft in the 4th lobby when i went to type to my team i got an error message as soon as i typed the first letter. 

 the game crashed and windows said it needed to shut down the program due to a c++ runtime error
 [at lest i'm pretty sure that's what it said it shut the window pretty quickly]

so i had a 15 minute wait to get back in the que, not really a big deal. when i get into the next lobby 15 mins later i have the same thing happen, and now i have a 2 hour wait, which kinda sucks. but i'm wondering is this something on my end or is it just a bug?

i haven't done anything to my game files, don't run any 3rd party programs and to my knowledge haven't done anything that would have caused this, especially mid gaming session like this.

also i was wondering in 2 hours if it happens again will the timer keep going up or will i get a ban or somthing?

any help resolving this  or advice would be greatly appreciated.

p.s. just to clarify this is occuring in the lobby at champ select.

replies.body:
seems to work now thanks.

any idea why it would mess up like that?

Could be a few reasons, but I believe the most likely factor is not updating Windows.  That's my first hunch, at least.  Aside from a manual download, an update should automatically pick those products up.  Glad to hear everything is okay now!

It sounds like your a product with your OS is malfunctioning and not properly interacting with League.  As a first step, I suggest downloading and reinstalling [ Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable Package](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=3387) per the error you're receiving.  Test this out in a custom game to prevent further penalties!  Let me know if you have any issues afterwards!
